title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A philosophical book that tells the story of Santiago, a shepherd boy who dreams of finding a treasure located near the Egyptian pyramids.

title: Red Dragon
author: Thomas Harris
description: THE GREAT BOOK OF THE GREATEST OF THE MASTERS OF THE GENRE. THE BEGINNING OF THE STORY OF THE GREAT AND TERRIBLE HANNIBAL LECTER. A novel that precedes the cult book: The Silence of the Lambs. The famous film adaptation starring Anthony Hopkins.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A novel set in the Roaring Twenties that tells the story of Jay Gatsby's unrequited love for Daisy Buchanan.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality, narrated by a young girl named Scout Finch.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A story about teenage angst and alienation, narrated by the cynical Holden Caulfield.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian novel that explores a technologically advanced future where society is engineered for maximum happiness.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: A novel about a future society where books are outlawed and 'firemen' burn any that are found.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fantasy novel that follows the journey of Bilbo Baggins as he embarks on an adventure with a group of dwarves.
